Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Sherd
Description: Sherd from good quality bowl. Hemispherical in shape, it was black, shiny and polished inside. Reminiscent of C-Group bowls (see L 1537 (h)), it bears an incised basketry imitation decoration: a checkered pattern with hatching. A further impressed dotted line emphasises the lip. The white paste that fills the hollow of the incisions enhances the decorative elements.
